title: Neuratron PhotoScore & NotateMe Ultimate 8.0.4.0 + Patch MPT
description:
SHEET MUSIC & PDF SCANNING, HANDWRITTEN ENTRY

PhotoScore & NotateMe Ultimate reads virtually all markings in printed music, and most in handwritten music, including (handwritten capabilities highlighted in bold) :

- 5-line staves (normal and small),  4- and 6- line guitar staves, 1-, 2- and 3-line percussion staves
- Notes, chords (including stem direction, beams & flags) and rests (including multirests) in up to 4 voices per staff
- Appoggiaturas (grace notes), cue-sized and cross-staff notes
- Accidentals and articulation marks
- Clefs, key signatures, time signatures
- Tuplets/triplets
- The format of the page, including the page size, staff size, margins, and where systems end
- Slurs, ties and hairpins
- Text including lyrics, dynamics, fingerings, instrument names, tempo and technique markings
- Guitar chord diagrams
- Various other markings such as codas, segnos, ornaments, pedal markings and repeat endings
- 64 staves per page
- 400 pages per score

What's new in PhotoScore & NotateMe Ultimate 8?
 
Our NotateMe music handwriting apps have been a huge success for tablets & phones, the pioneering technology being used on 100,000s of devices worldwide.
 
By popular demand we have integrated NotateMe into PhotoScore 8, which means the composer in you can now handwrite scores on your Windows or Mac tablet/laptop! It is especially optimized to work with the Microsoft Surface touch screen and stylus, but also works with other pen devices or a mouse/trackpad.
 
Of course, we have not forgotten PDF and sheet music scanning, and version 8 sees many improvements:
 
- Conversion of low resolution PDFs & scans down to 72 dpi
- Increased accuracy
- Compatibility with Sibelius 8
- More sophisticated automatic voice allocation
- Improved tuplet recognition
- Optimized recognition of curved and distorted staves
- 30% faster printed music recognition
- Improved MusicXML score export
- Opens and reads JPEGs (for example, taken with a camera)
- Saves scores as PDFs (Mac OS X version using Print to PDF)
- Improved part extraction/rescoring
- Many bug fixes and usability improvements
 
Homepage http://www.neuratron.com/photoscore.htm
